2:Ta65,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Pastelitos Criollos","description":"Flaky fried pastries filled with quince paste (membrillo) or sweet potato paste (batata), traditionally eaten on May 25th and other national holidays. Crunchy, sweet, and deeply nostalgic.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/pastelitos.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT30M","cookTime":"PT20M","totalTime":"PT50M","recipeYield":"12 servings","recipeCategory":"dessert","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"pastelitos recipe, argentine pastries, pastelitos criollos, fried pastries argentina, membrillo pastries","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"260 calories","proteinContent":"3g","carbohydrateContent":"34g","fatContent":"13g"},"recipeIngredient":["For the pastry: 2 sheets puff pastry (store-bought is fine), thawed","For the pastry: Oil for deep frying (enough for 2 inches in pot)","For the pastry: 1 egg white, lightly beaten (for sealing)","For the filling: 200g (7 oz) dulce de membrillo (quince paste), cut into small rectangles","For the filling: 200g (7 oz) dulce de batata (sweet potato paste), cut into small rectangles","For the syrup glaze: 1 cup sugar","For the syrup glaze: 1/2 cup water","For the syrup glaze: 1 tbsp lemon juice"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Make the syrup: boil sugar, water, and lemon juice until slightly thickened (about 5 minutes). Keep warm."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Cut puff pastry sheets into 4-inch squares. You should get about 12 squares."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Place a small rectangle of membrillo or batata in the center of each square."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Brush the edges with egg white. Fold the pastry diagonally to form a triangle, pressing edges firmly to seal. Use a fork to crimp the edges."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"For the traditional shape, use a sharp knife to make a small decorative slit or pattern on top."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Heat oil in a deep pot to 350°F (175°C). The oil should be at least 2 inches deep."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Fry pastelitos 2-3 at a time, turning once, until puffed and deeply golden — about 2-3 minutes per side."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"Remove with a slotted spoon and immediately dip in the warm sugar syrup, coating all sides."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"Place on a wire rack to drain. Let cool slightly before eating — the filling is molten hot inside."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-5xl mx-auto px-4 py-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/food/recipes","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-arrow-left w-4 h-4","aria-hidden":"true","children":["$L4","$L5","$undefined"]}],"All Recipes"],"data-slot":"button","data-variant":"ghost","data-size":"sm","className":"inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50 h-8 rounded-md px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5 gap-2","ref":null}]}]}]}],"$L6","$L7","$L8"]}],null,"$L9"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}

10:["$","div",null,{"className":"lg:col-span-2 space-y-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-4 text-sm print:hidden","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-gray-500","children":"Jump to:"}],["$","a",null,{"href":"#instructions","className":"text-orange-600 hover:underline","children":"Instructions"}],["$","a",null,{"href":"#tips","className":"text-orange-600 hover:underline","children":"Tips"}],["$","a",null,{"href":"#history","className":"text-orange-600 hover:underline","children":"History"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"instructions","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-xl","children":"Instructions"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ol",null,{"className":"space-y-6","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":1}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Make the syrup: boil sugar, water, and lemon juice until slightly thickened (about 5 minutes). Fold the pastry diagonally to form a triangle, pressing edges firmly to seal. 17:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm bg-gradient-to-br from-amber-50 to-orange-50 border-amber-100 print:bg-none print:border-gray-300","id":"tips","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-lightbulb w-5 h-5 text-amber-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1gvzjb",{"d":"M15 14c.2-1 .7-1.7 1.5-2.5 1-.9 1.5-2.2 1.5-3.5A6 6 0 0 0 6 8c0 1 .2 2.2 1.5 3.5.7.7 1.3 1.5 1.5 2.5"}],["$","path","x1upvd",{"d":"M9 18h6"}],["$","path","ceow96",{"d":"M10 22h4"}],"$undefined"]}],"Pro Tips from the Kitchen"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ul",null,{"className":"space-y-3","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The oil temperature is critical — too cool and they absorb oil and become greasy, too hot and they brown before the inside cooks. Use a thermometer."}]]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Seal the edges very well or the filling will leak out during frying. The fork crimp is both decorative and functional."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Make both membrillo and batata versions — guests will have a strong preference for one or the other. In Argentina, this is a passionate debate."}]]}]]}]}]]}]
18:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Pastelitos are one of Argentina's most traditional sweets, dating back to the colonial era. They've been sold in the streets since the May Revolution of 1810 — legend says vendors sold them in the Plaza de Mayo during the revolution itself. Today, eating pastelitos on May 25th (Revolution Day) is as important as eating locro. Vendors fry them fresh on street corners during national holidays, and the smell of hot oil and sugar syrup is synonymous with Argentine patriotism."}]}]]}]
19:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Best eaten within hours of frying. They lose crispness quickly. Store at room temperature in a paper bag for up to 1 day — do not refrigerate or they'll go soggy."}]}]]}]
